title: Strictly's Karen Hauer oozes sartorial chic as she leaves It Takes Two with boyfriend David Webb
text:
She's been taking to the dancefloor with comedian Chris Ramsey.

But Strictly Come Dancing pro Karen Hauer was accompanied by her boyfriend David Webb as she exited It Takes Two filming on Monday.

The dancer, 37, oozed sartorial chic in an electric blue suit and silver heels as she left the BBC Studios in London with her beau, 36.

Chic: Strictly Come Dancing pro Karen Hauer, 37, made a statement in an electric blue suit as she exited It Takes Two filming with boyfriend David Webb, 36, on Monday

Karen proudly displayed her slender physique in the bright blue blazer with a satin lapel, which she teamed with matching cropped trousers.

The Venezuelan beauty teamed the look with a classic white vest and thick-strapped silver heels, as she held on her beau's arm on their way out of the studio.

Still sporting her dramatic makeup from the TV appearance, Karen amped up the glamour with a dramatic bronzed smoky eye as she exited the TV studio.

Opera singer David was also wrapped up in a khaki green jacket and mustard yellow as he headed home with his glamorous partner.

Dressed up: The Venezuelan pro oozed sartorial chic in an electric blue trouser suit as she left the BBC Studios in London

Perfect: Karen highlighted her slender figure in the fitted blue suit which she teamed with metallic strapped heels

Cosy: Opera singer David was wrapped up in a khaki green coat and mustard yellow scarf as he accompanied his girlfriend leaving the TV appearance

Their outing comes after Karen revealed that she 'wasn't in a good place mentally or physically' following her divorce from Kevin Clifton.

Speaking in an interview with Hello! magazine, the dancer said: 'I'd taken a big hit and I was going through a whole explosion of emotions.

'My life was completely changing from one day to another. It did affect me mentally and physically – I wasn’t in a good place.'

Struggles: Their outing comes after Karen revealed that she 'wasn't in a good place mentally or physically' following her divorce from Kevin Clifton

Sweet: In a recent interview Karen gushed about her new beau David, describing him as 'her rock' following her split from husband Kevin

And while Karen has found happiness, so too has her ex, who has moved on with broadcaster Stacey Dooley, 32, whom he was paired with in the previous series of Strictly.

Touching on his new romance, Karen said: 'It's nice to see him calm which I had not seen in years. Maybe it takes that bit of trauma to make you both realise this is what we need to do. And at the same time, we haven’t lost one another.'

With the pair still interacting on a daily basis on the BBC dance show, Karen adds that things are all good between them, stating that she'll 'never lose his friendship' because there's 'love' and 'admiration' between them.

Touching: She added: 'It’s so nice to have someone that understands and accepts me, doesn't judge and doesn't try to change me in any way'

Gorgeous: While a smitten David, who didn't know who Karen was before they met, describes himself as the 'luckiest man on this earth'

Meanwhile, Karen gushed over her current beau David in the chat, she said: 'He's my rock.

'It’s so nice to have someone that understands and accepts me, doesn't judge and doesn't try to change me in any way. Everyone just falls in love with him too, because he has such a beautiful soul.'

While a smitten David, who didn't know who Karen was before they met, describes himself as the 'luckiest man on this earth.'

And after finding love again after such a traumatic period in her life, Karen confessed that she wouldn't be opposed to walking down the aisle once more, adding 'never say never'.
description: The dancer, 37, oozed sartorial chic in an electric blue suit and silver heels as she left the BBC Studios in London with her beau, 36.
